near.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: only a short distance from a person or thing
near.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
They moved house to be nearer the school.
She told the children not to go near the canal.
I’m warning you – don’t come any nearer!
We heard voices as we drew near the village.
a hotel near to the beach
near.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: soon before a particular time or event
near.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I didn’t remember to phone until near the end of the week.
They should send us more details nearer the time of the concert.
I’ll give you a ring a bit nearer to Christmas.
near.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: almost doing something or almost in a particular state
near.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The work is now near completion.
A lot of the women were near tears.
We are no nearer an agreement than we were six months ago.
He was near to panic as he scrambled out of the building.
He seemed to know that he was near to death.
near.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: almost at a particular amount or level
near.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: He looked nearer fifty than forty.
Unemployment is now near to its all-time low.
Strawberries are near the top of the list.
near.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if something is near something else, it is similar to it
near.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: His story was near enough the truth for people to believe it.
It may not be an exact replica but it’s pretty damn near.
They say that love is very near to hate.
near.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: only a short distance from something or someone
I live near Salzburg in Austria.
If we moved to Dallas, we’d be near my parents.
very near something or someone, or almost touching them
The hotel is close to the beach.
Nancy came and sat close beside me on the bed.
not far (away)
not a long distance away – used when saying that a place is near enough to be easy to get to
The station’s not far away from here.
nearby
near here or near a particular place
Is there a post office nearby?
A group of reporters were waiting nearby.
within walking distance (of something)
easy to walk to from somewhere, or near enough to something for you to walk there
There’s a good school within walking distance.
The house is within walking distance of shopping facilities.
be convenient for something
to be near a place that people want to get to, so that the place is easy to reach
The area is very convenient for Gatwick airport.
I want a hotel that’s convenient for the city centre.
locally
in or near the area where you are or the area you are talking about
I prefer to buy fruit and vegetables that are grown locally.
around here
in the general area near here
Parking is impossible around here.
Is there a garage round here?
in the neighbourhood
living or existing in the area where you are or the area you are talking about
We grew up knowing all the other kids in the neighbourhood.
There’s very little crime in the neighborhood.
in the vicinity
in the area around and near a particular place – used especially in news reports
A white van was seen in the vicinity at the time the murder took place.
neighbouring
used about towns, countries etc that are very near a particular place
discussions between Egypt and neighbouring states
The rioting quickly spread to neighbouring areas.
near.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: only a short distance away from someone or something
near.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It’s a beautiful house but it’s 20 miles away from the nearest town.
We can meet at the pub or in the restaurant, whichever’s nearer for you.
near.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: You usually use near as a preposition You say
The hotel is near the airport
The hotel is near to the airport
Near is not usually used on its own as an adjective You don’t usually say ‘The village is near’ You usually say
The village is not far away
You use nearby before a noun
We went to a nearby park
We went to a near park
You can use the forms nearer and nearest as adjectives
You can use nearest before a noun
They headed for the nearest beach
near.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a relative who is very closely related to you such as a parent
near.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The death of a near relative is a terrible trauma for a child.
near.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: used to describe the side of something that is closest to where you are
near.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: the near bank of the river
near.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: used when talking about the parts of a vehicle to mean the one that is closest to the side of the road when you drive
near.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: The headlight on the near side isn’t working.
near.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to come closer to a place
near.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: She began to feel nervous as she neared the house.
The ship was nearing the harbour.
near.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to come closer to being in a particular state
near.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to come closer to a particular time
near.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: He was nearing the end of his stay in India.
near.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: if a time nears, it gets closer and will come soon
near.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: He got more and more nervous as the day of his departure neared.
